message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MA, cs.GT. 

The paper deals with scheduling in wireless networks, which is a topic that falls under the umbrella of information theory (cs.IT) and networked systems (cs.NI). The use of Markov-modulated channels and the exploration-exploitation trade-off suggest that the paper may also be relevant to the subfields of control theory (cs.SY) and machine learning (cs.MA). Finally, the analysis of the Whittle's Index Policy involves game-theoretic concepts, which could place the paper in the category of game theory (cs.GT).
